metadata.title: CVE-2019-8912 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel through 4.20.11, af_alg_release() in crypto/af_alg.cneglects to set a NULL value for a certain structure member, which leads toa use-after-free in sockfs_setattr.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8912` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-47-generic - 4.15.0-47.50~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-47-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-47.50~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-47-lowlatency - 4.15.0-47.50~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-47-generic - 4.15.0-47.50~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-47-lowlatency - 4.15.0-47.50~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1041-azure - 4.15.0-1041.45
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1029-gcp - 4.15.0-1029.31~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-9019-euclid - 4.4.0-9019.20

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-47.50~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1041.45').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1029.31~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-euclid package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-9019.20').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1035.37~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1010.12~16.04.1').
